title: What's New in Sitepins — January 2026
details:
We kicked off 2026 with some major updates — focused on removing friction, enhancing collaboration, and giving you more control over your workflow.

## 100+ Pre-configured Templates
**What:** Over [100+ pre-configured templates](https://app.sitepins.com/templates) built with Astro, Hugo, and Next.js by Themefisher and Gethugothemes.

**Why:** Choose a template and start editing immediately — no setup required, one click and you're ready to go.

## Deploy to Vercel
**What:** Direct Vercel deployment from Sitepins with automatic sync for every content change.

**Why:** Connect your repo to Vercel directly from Sitepins. Every change triggers a rebuild automatically — no manual builds, no deployment steps.

## GitLab Repository Support
**What:** Sitepins now supports GitLab repositories in addition to GitHub.

**Why:** Teams using GitLab for CI/CD can now integrate Sitepins without changing their existing workflows.

## Multiple Branching Support
**What:** Full GitHub branch management — create branches, open PRs, and merge directly from Sitepins.

**Why:** Experiment and review changes without affecting production. Developers stay in control while non-technical teammates collaborate freely.

## Email-based Access
**What:** Grant access using only an email address — no GitHub or GitLab account required.

**Why:** Clients and non-technical teammates can now edit content without needing a Git account.

## Improved SEO Suggestions
**What:** Better SEO recommendations with slug editing, SERP preview, content/link analysis, and best practice guardrails.

**Why:** Keeps content optimized and prevents broken links or poorly formatted URLs during editing.

## UI/UX Revamp
**What:** Refined interface with consistent left-side navigation, clearer layout, and better organization.

**Why:** Project switching is simpler, settings are easier to find, and the overall experience is smoother.

## Global Search (Cmd/Ctrl + K)
**What:** Search across your entire repository with a keyboard shortcut.

**Why:** For large sites, finding the right file instantly saves significant time.

## Media File & Folder Rename
**What:** Rename media files and folders directly within Sitepins.

**Why:** Better file naming improves organization, SEO, and long-term maintainability.

## Bug Fixes
- Fixed cursor positioning when switching between Markdown and Rich Text editor modes
- Resolved extra HTML entities being added when using shortcodes
- Fixed AI suggestions appearing across the entire document instead of only selected text
- Corrected plan name not updating after purchase or trial activation
- Fixed content not rendering due to schema mismatches
